metadata.title: CVE-2024-46461 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
VLC media player 3.0.20 and earlier is vulnerable to denial of servicethrough an integer overflow which could be triggered with a maliciouslycrafted mms stream (heap based overflow). If successful, a malicious thirdparty could trigger either a crash of VLC or an arbitrary code executionwith the target user's privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-46461` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
libvlc5 - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
libvlccore9 - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-bin - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-data - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-l10n - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vlc package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm3').
